definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: With tears that tell of broken dreams.
sentences.chinese: 饱含的泪水讲述的是一个个破碎的迷梦。

sentences.english: But all this was essentially lunacy.
sentences.chinese: 但这一切基本上是迷梦和狂想。

sentences.english: Freedom from love and glitter of gold;
Oh, help me please is there someone who can make me wake up from this dream?
sentences.chinese: 阿，帮助我吧，谁能让我从这迷梦中醒来。

sentences.english: Then it was better to leave this affair being what it was---a midnight dream.
sentences.chinese: 那么就当这一切是一场午夜的迷梦吧。

sentences.english: Darling I hope that my dream never haunted you.
sentences.chinese: 爱人哪但愿我的迷梦从未纠缠你。

sentences.english: The harshness of recent reality disenchanted her of her idealistic hopes.
sentences.chinese: 最近的严酷现实使她从理想主义的迷梦中清醒过来。

sentences.english: And drives away dark dreaming night.

definition: to be as if.../to be rather like...
dream of golden millet/fig. illusions of wealth and power/pipe dream
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
